title: Parashant Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument: Learn About the Park
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park           Learn About the Park         Remains of a historic building at Grand Gulch Mine.   Rugged, wild and beautiful, Grand Canyon-Parashant National Monument is located on the edge of one of the most beautiful places on earth, the Grand Canyon. Views of once violent eruptions and flowing basalt, and the destructive force of earthquakes are evident in the layers of exposed geologic history on the monument. Prehistoric trails, villages, and rock art images bring clues to the life once lived by the ancient people who once inhabited this land.      News Browse press releases, subscribe to updates and dig into archived news.   Photos and more Can't get to the monument today? Check out our photo galleries and videos.     Science and Research One of the major reasons this monument exists is to facilitate research. Whatever your favorite -ology, find out what science projects are being conducted on the monument.   Education Whether you are near or far you can learn more about the natural world. Use our lesson plans in your classroom or browse for professional development opportunities.   Kids & Youth Learn how to become a Jr. Ranger.   Management Find out more about the Monument's laws and policies, regulations and management plans.
